title: Philemon: Gospel Reconciliation
objective: See how the gospel transforms social relationships through forgiveness, honor, and restored fellowship.

required_passages.text: I appeal to you for my child, Onesimus... receive him no longer as a bondservant but more than a bondservant, as a beloved brother... refresh my heart in Christ.

segments.audio_script: Philemon is short but profound: gospel theology embodied in relational reconciliation.

Listen to Philemon. Paul writes from prison on behalf of Onesimus, once useless but now useful, asking Philemon to receive him as a beloved brother. Paul offers to cover any debt and appeals on the basis of love rather than command, modeling Christlike mediation and reconciliation.
In a world shaped by status and coercion, Paul reframes relationship in terms of family in Christ.
The gospel does not remain abstract; it rewires power, debt, and identity. Forgiveness and mutual honor become tangible signs of new creation community.
Key themes include reconciliation, forgiveness, mediation, brotherhood in Christ, and transformed relationships.
Reflect on this: Who might God be calling you to receive, forgive, or advocate for in gospel love?
Pauline Epistles conclude with reconciliation lived out. Next we can begin General Epistles and Revelation.
